Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!
What do you call fake spaghetti? An impasta!

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about animals
Do you know any animal facts?
I want to learn something about animals
responses: Did you know that octopuses have three hearts?
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
Koalas sleep up to 22 hours a day.
A shrimp's heart is located in its head.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about space
Do you know any space facts?
I want to learn something about space
responses: The hottest planet in our solar system is Venus.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Neutron stars are so dense that a sugar-cube sized amount of material would weigh more than all of humanity.
The Sun's mass takes up 99.86% of the solar system.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about science

I want to learn something about science
responses: The human brain is more active during sleep than during the day.
Honey never spoils, it can last for centuries.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to thermal expansion.
The first oranges weren't orange.

patterns: Tell me a fun fact about history

I want to learn something about history
responses: The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896.
The Great Wall of China is around 13,170 miles long.
The oldest known recipe is for beer.
The first computer virus was created in 1983.
The first known use of the word 'computer' was in 1613.
